summary: A presentation by Nikhilesh Das on using waste materials to address oil pollution.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a white background featuring a blue ink bottle with a black feather quill, accompanied by the text "NIKHILESH DAS" and "THE INK CONFERENCE" in blue and red, along with the TED logo. The scene transitions to a white background with the text "Brought to you by GENPACT" in light blue. The video then shifts to a stage where a man in a light-colored shirt and dark pants stands in front of a large screen displaying "Nikhilesh Das" and "INK" in blue. The stage is decorated with intricate designs, including a hot air balloon, a heart, and a rocket. The man speaks to an audience, gesturing with his hands. The background features a large, illuminated "INK" sign in blue, with the man continuing to speak and gesture. The video concludes with the man still on stage, emphasizing his points with hand movements, while the "INK" sign remains prominently displayed behind him.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with ambient sounds of applause, setting a tone of appreciation. A male speaker begins a presentation, stating "as we all know, water pollution has become one of the biggest issues of the 21st century" and further emphasizing the severe impact of oil on water resources. The presentation then abruptly ends, transitioning into a subdued music piece. The music, characterized by a downtempo, electronic soundscape, features synthetic pads and basslines, creating a contemplative and somber atmosphere.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker recounting an experience from his childhood. He mentions watching TV and witnessing the "harmful effects of water pollution" caused by oil effluents, which sparked a desire to find easy and inexpensive ways to control water pollution. The tone is conversational and reflective.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man on stage, dressed in a casual grey t-shirt and jeans, engaging with an audience. events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker begins with a reflective tone, recalling a childhood memory of disliking oil in his hair and questioning why it stuck. He then shifts to a more factual tone, explaining an experiment conducted using a beaker from a school laboratory. He describes pouring water and oil, noting the oil forming a layer, followed by adding waste human hair. The speaker pauses, indicating a waiting period. During this narration, ambient background sounds are present.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker continuing a story with an informative tone, recalling reading a newspaper article about an oil spill in Kuwait during the Gulf War, resulting in migratory bird deaths. He questions why the oil stuck to the birds' feathers. Transitioning to a more observational tone, he describes getting a beaker, pouring water and oil into it, and then adding bird feathers. He prefaces the next action with "Now," suggesting an imminent change.  The clip ends with the male speaker starting the next sentence, "Now, moving on, what." There are no audible background sounds or music present in the clip.

events_list.video_caption: A man stands on a stage, wearing a light gray t-shirt and jeans, speaking to an audience. Behind him, a large screen displays the word "INK" in bold, blue letters. The stage is decorated with a pirate ship and floral designs, creating a thematic backdrop. On the table in front of him, various objects are arranged, including bottles, beakers, and feathers. The man gestures with his hands as he speaks, engaging with the audience. He then picks up a bottle and pours its contents into a beaker, demonstrating a process. events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker sharing an anecdote about a carpenter spilling oil in his house and using sawdust to clean it up, noting the oil sticking to the sawdust. He then describes a follow-up experiment with water, oil, and sawdust, mentioning the formation of an oil layer. He says that he will then remove each of the ingredients one by one. The speaker mentions one of the ingredients being "waste human hair." Finally, he says he is moving on to his first ingredient. A distinct, low-frequency buzz-like sound then emerges and persists.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a gray t-shirt and a wristwatch is seen standing behind a table filled with various objects, including beakers, a bottle of oil, and other scientific equipment. He is holding a glass of water and appears to be conducting an experiment or demonstration. The background features a blue and black design with abstract patterns and shapes, creating a visually engaging atmosphere. The man gestures with his hands, indicating that he is explaining or discussing the experiment. The camera focuses on his actions and the objects on the table, highlighting the details of the experiment. The lighting is bright, emphasizing the clarity of the glass and the water inside. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest that he is engaged and enthusiastic about the demonstration. The video captures the essence of a scientific presentation, with the man actively interacting with the audience and the objects on the table.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a single male speaker who begins by confidently announcing that 95% of oil effluence is removed in the first attempt. He then transitions to discuss bird feathers, again noting a similar 95% removal rate. Moving on to sawdust, he reiterates the 95% efficiency, concluding that he has found three ingredients for cleaning oil effluence from water. He emphasizes the advantages, noting the ingredients' waste nature. In the background, polite applause can be heard.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing on a stage, wearing a light gray t-shirt and dark pants, engaging in a presentation. events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with one male speaker explaining how his process cleans waste with another waste. He describes this as easy, inexpensive, and hassle-free for removing oil from water, and mentions creating a machine to use these ingredients, reuse the residue, and allow oil to be reused by industries and refineries. The speaker expresses his plans to work on pollution and the environment to save the world, before thanking the audience. Overlaid, inspirational and mellow electronic music plays throughout, with a noticeable bass line, as well as some other effects. The clip ends with a burst of audience applause.
